Context: The Distance Education program offers a home-study approach to learn robotics and automated systems. It requires only a personal computer and an Internet connection. The learning materials include 14 modules with various formats such as text, audio, 2D and 3D animations, computer-based testing, and RoboLogix simulation software. Open enrolment is available with no specific time limits to complete each module. Prerequisites include an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent or mature student status, but an electronics background is helpful but not essential. Career opportunities include installation, service, maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of robots and automated production systems, as well as working as a robotics trainer. The program consists of 14 required courses: ELNC 9101 - Introduction to Robotics; ELNC 9103 - Robot Classifications; ELNC 9108 - Manipulators and End Effectors; ELNC 9102 - Robot Drive Systems; ELNC 9106 - Servo Systems; ELNC 9105 - Payload, Repeatability and Accuracy; ELNC 9107 - Object Detection; ELNC 9112 - Vision, Touch and Sound; ELNC 9113 - Robot Programming; ELNC 9111 - Robot Safety; ELNC 9110 - Communications; ELNC 9109 - Applications; ELNC 9104 - Artificial Intelligence; and ELNC 9121 - Autonomous Robots.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Robotics Technician Program (Distance Education) T948 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Name: Artificial Intelligence
Course Code: ELNC 9121
Courses Offered: Autonomous Robots
Tuition and Fees:
- Domestic Students: $1,660.00 (Fall 2022)
  - Registration Fee: $490 (includes learning materials, software, user guide, and Module 1)
  - Module fee: $90/module for the remaining 13 modules
- International Students: US$490 (same fees but in U.S. dollars)
Additional Costs: None mentioned
Financial Assistance: Not eligible for OSAP funding
Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English: C or U
- Grade 11 math: M or U, or grade 12: C or U
- Mature student status (19 years of age or older)
Special Requirements:
- Online distance program for international students is only available while remaining in their home country and does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada.
- Minimum system requirements: Pentium-based PC, 512MB RAM (recommended 1GB), 250MB available hard disk space, Windows 7/8/8.1/10/11, email account, and Internet access.

Context: The online distance program for robotics offered by George Brown College is not available to students in Canada for study or work permit eligibility. Interested applicants can call 416-415-4726 or toll-free 1-888-553-5333, or email [info@gbctechtraining.com](mailto:info@gbctechtraining.com). The program is available on Apple computers running Mac Operating Systems, Chromebooks running Chrome Operating Systems, and devices running Linux Operating Systems. The applicants need to check the course details along with an interactive video tour at onlinerobotics.com. Related programs include Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146), Mechanical Engineering Technology – Design (T121), and Electromechanical Engineering Technology – Building Automation (T171). Applicants can book a campus tour and sign up to receive tailored resources to make their application process easier.
